channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ticked Off Over Preauthorization: Walk-In Patient Avoided Lyme Disease but Not a Surprise Bill
item.description: A Maine woman sought care at a clinic for a tick bite, then paid full price after her insurer denied coverage. Its reason? She didn't have preapproval...

item.title: How 'defund Planned Parenthood' came to threaten primary care in rural Maine

item.title: Breast Cancer and Birth Control: A Huge New Study Shows How Science Can Be Distorted
item.description: The study sought to answer questions about how breast cancer risk differs by type of hormonal contraceptive. Doctors say the results won’t change how ...

item.title: For clues on how to evade cancer, some scientists look to the bowhead whale
item.description: Where might we look for inspiration for new cancer therapies? Some researchers say the bowhead whale may offer clues.

item.title: Dementia housing without locked wards? It's a small but growing movement
item.description: Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.
